9cU2f5WFKR6cjPsVpXw7Mg.text: When we asked the hostess how much time for 2 people to be seated at a table, she insisted that we could sit at the bar. Despite multiple other attempts we gave up and sat at the bar. The food is tapas only and were very small portions of mediocre food. A disappointing stop indeed in Piccadilly.

o6OKfr_LMBka1-dR1KB48w.text: Food and service great, all I can say is go there in you are in London. Have the Burrata with prosciutto, chicken spadini and for dessert the pannaCotta is amazing

2iMlo0RKhMPJeY8FI2vtIA.text: I must have come on a bad night.  Fatty octopus, lukewarm pasta with crab -- chomped on two shell pieces and taste was bland. Pass...London has better to offer.

x8Ci6ImfrqVVMBX99MGtTQ.text: Beautiful atmosphere with great style. Had one of the most balanced, beautifully designed cocktails in a while; basil, pineapple, soda and rum, sooo good! Food is great too with speedy service and Italian pizzazz. Particularly enjoyed the seafood fritti, fresh calamari and garlic aioli. Also enjoyed the rib eye with garlic and chilli, not so much the veal, too thin and the coating wasn't right. Loved my panna cotta dessert, best I've tried in London! Double espresso came with flaky pastry-I wasn't hungry anymore but ate them all anyway!?! Lovely touch. Finally, lots of the staff said thank you and goodbye, a thoroughly enjoyable evening. NB. Reserve a table and try to sit at the back to see into the kitchen!

0NA2hE4NewUd7bn4TOvcpQ.text: This is by far one of the best restaurants I have ever eaten at. The ambiance is sophisticated without being too stuffy. It reminded me of a chic NYC restaurant mixed with an Italian bistro. The service was attentive and helpful. The food is served tapas style and is meant to be shared, so be prepared to order a few dishes to experience the broad range of delicacies. Everything we ordered was amazingly fresh and flavorful. I ordered a truffle ravioli and it was sooooo good! I didn't want to share with anyone! The best part of the restaurant was the fact that my very picky in-laws LOVED the food and will be frequenting the restaurant in the future. Yum, yum Cicchetti! I can't wait to go back!

wYBmB81aOUeU8xRnnUl7Fw.text: The best tiramisu ever. The atmosphere was fun and vibrant. We had mostly seafood for lunch, well prepared and wonderful presentation. I would come back for the tiramisu.

bfcJVSe_9YF0gMAJFHwkbQ.text: I enjoyed the ambiance of this restaurant and the Italian staff provided very attentive service.  The food is high quality, although not all the dishes were stand outs.  Overall I would recommend it as a great place to stop in to enjoy a classy Italian setting and have a drink and a few tapas.

TB10f79IAYbrTOf-CmEFsA.text: I am from Italy we ordered antipasto and pasta, the Pasta  it was very good and fresh but Antipasto It wasn't . The Manager he was too rude with us,  he told to us to sit to the left side of the table cuz the other one it was an obstacle for the waiters of the restaurant..... But since I am a costumer is it my right to choose where I am goin to sit isn't it?

BgD0-2A_3CaybuD58zxfOQ.text: So, when my mum recommended to me an Italian small-plates restaurant right next to Piccadilly Circus, you can understand why I felt rather sceptical and envisioned a rather overpriced tourist trap with excessively salty food.  However, my mum is quite particular about food and I must say that, from the outside, the window display is rather enticing with hanging charcuterie, arrays of pasta, and an assorted variety of fish.  You can also catch a glimpse of the salad counter which, whilst not as enticing as the awesome Franze and Evans' near Brick Lane, is pretty.  The inside itself is rather swish with the marble tabletops and bar counter (although I'm undecided about the lemon-yellow chairs); overall, whilst smart, it still feels relaxed.The menu is split into what I guess is a standard all-year card, featuring several sections (bready items, soups, carpaccios, salads, meats, fishes, pastas), a smaller card with an array of seasonal dishes, and the daily specials board.As some may know, I deeply dislike 'small plates'-style dining, especially when it's referred to as tapas (not that Cicchetti does).  Maybe I'm just being overly whiny/grouchy, but I don't like getting a plate the 1/3 the size of a main dish for 2/3 of the price.  It's smart business, but it almost always leaves me feeling rather shafted.  Cicchetti does recommend "two people, 5-6 dishes for a full dining experience blah blah blah" and I was trying very very hard not to grumble (saved by the fact that the menu is pretty impressive), but eventually plopped for 6 dishes - fried calamari, tuna tartare, rare rib-eye steak, halibut with samphire and cherry toms, lobster risotto, and pennette amatriciana (pig cheek, red onion, and tomato sauce with small penne).  My mum also went for the two-oysters-with-glass-of-prosecco (the oysters were large and fresh - considering I'm not really a fan with them, I quite enjoyed them).I have to say, I was really impressed by the size of the dishes, especially the rib-eye and halibut dishes, both of which carried substantial chunks of meat.  The presentation was also great, and I really appreciated the painstaking effort that the waiter put into mixing my tuna tartare.  The quality of the food is really good generally - the halibut was particularly well put together with crunchy samphire next to soft fish and the tomatoes sweet-but tangy; the tartare was seasoned very nicely, not dominated by onions or capers; the steak was excellent - very juicy and chargrilled; the lobster risotto carrying plenty of shellfishy flavour (seems that they make the stock the right way).(another reason to dislike small plates - too many bloody dishes to write about)Hey, and my double espresso was very good too - whilst it should be a given in such a restaurant, it isn't always.  It's one of the few times I've been to a small plates restaurant and actually felt full.  Unfortunately, it did mean that I didn't have any room for dessert, but they look REALLY TASTY.The staff are very friendly; at the beginning of the meal I did feel a little hounded and rushed (two different waiters asked us for drinks, and when I asked for an extra few minutes to look over the menu, I got about 90 seconds).  Also, the plates all came out at once which was a bit of a logistical nightmare as the tables aren't particularly big.  However, after the food, we weren't turfed out with any haste, so overall, I didn't feel like we'd overstayed.It's not a cheap price - on average, the dishes are around 7-8 squid.  However, the dishes are a good size, and 4-5 would be sufficient for two people (say, the steak and a risotto or a pasta) if you aren't in full-on splashout mode.  My mum did say that the drinks are a bit on the pricey side, but I can't really comment on those.  Minus the oysters, the bill still came out to around £10 less than Ceviche (£35 per head and I wasn't full afterwards), so it's relatively good value.I found it hard to believe that it wasn't a trap, but, well, it's not a trap!  It's not a trap.  It's the first time I've really enjoyed an Italian meal in London for a while, and I really appreciated how well the food is put together.  Definitely looking forward to the return trip!

aXSt8fURDUx1z_-4YFKbVw.text: Fairly good for a first meal in London.  I was initially suspicious as this was recommended by the hotel porter with quite short notice as well as the card reading that it was open for breakfast, lunch and dinner.  However, it was not the tourist trap I was expecting.  A bit pricey but overall the food was good and the service as well.

7aMOuUH24hV-Ov5Bkyba1g.text: One of the best Italian restaurants I've been to in London. The food comes in small tapas portions but the flavour is intense! Ask the server for their most popular dishes.

z2eqPQv4er7vHus6vRutnQ.text: A fantastic gem in any country, but a true oasis in London. Wonderful authentic Italian Tapas style served by efficient, friendly staff.

Bb-5vrrc3QG7iTXhs1-ntg.text: The food is every bit as wonderful as previously reviewed. One specific recommendation: the Truffle and Pecorino Ravioli. Unbelievable. Also, if alone or as a couple, consider eating at the bar. Tremendously entertaining and Italian bar staff.

Qe1MNd4Ythkt7eFT-wqplg.text: The food is delicious. The menu list small plates. It is designed that way so you order several plates and share them. We love all the plates, the wine was excellent. They are on the expensive side (especially since we order a bottle of wine) but worth the price.

0ZyYIb5RnDrszVBJGTUFyg.text: Wow! We are here on my birthday in November and it was one of the best meals ever. As a family of 4 from America on a quick holiday to London we were lucky to find this place. 7 of the 8 dishes were above average. It is small plate Italian tapas.  Don't let it's location right in Piccadilly fool you- it is far from the tourist chains in the area. The atmosphere is lively and modern yet classic. Service was a good balance of attentive but not overbearing.  The food came out very fast even though the place was packed. Next time I would  order slower.

eMkiIC0rOENnsitt464ffw.text: Delicious pasta, excellent wines, great service! This is the real deal italian food at its best. This was my second visit and they did not disappoint. We were a group of six and everyone was blown away by how good the food was. I will definitely be back!

XYNY6BAkMyFj20CVA6NC_g.text: Ordered: Carbonara, Home made ravioli, Gambarini, Zucchini chips, Lamb chops, Fried Prawns, Tiramisu, Panettone desert.Price: About £40 per head. Each dish about £7-£15.Review: I used to walk past this restaurant when I used to work in the vicinity, but it never struck me as a place to visit (even though the hand made pasta sits by the window sill)...anyway - so I was advised by an amazing cook to try their carbonara....this friend's carbonara is as good as it gets so to get a recommendation from her!!!! The Carbonara at Cicchetti is pretty amazing!!! HOWEVER, I would not rate it so highly in comparison to the carbonara I eat when I'm in my small removed town in Italy which I frequently visited when I was younger. BUT STILL, I RATE IT VERY HIGHLY!!!! One of my new favourite Italian restaurants in London!

photos.caption: Photo of San Carlo Cicchetti - London, United Kingdom. Home made ravioli!

pWb6ZuAd8gLellkq0DJiqw.text: My second (and not the last) visit to this restaurant was such a great experience! We came here for a business dinner on Friday night, and everything was great -- the service, every dish, and the ambiance. Our guest was vegetarian so we ordered both of the risottos, one butternut squash and the other with mushrooms and shaved truffles -- SO good. Every dish that came out was so well presented. Everything is tapas style so you can try a bunch of stuff. Don't think we got a single bad or even OK dish. We'll definitely be back!

ExVPn2riLIrTNFTtGUT4FQ.text: Excellent tapas-style Italian.  We had the mussels, calamari, chicken pizza and a marinara spaghetti with prawns.  One of the best Italian meals in memory.  Highly recommended.

photos.caption: Photo of San Carlo Cicchetti - London, United Kingdom. Right across the street from the James Bond cars exhibit.

Fqcl1S7ggjOWMPoTfZUf8A.text: Friendly waitstaff and atmosphere and great Italian tapas options.  Enjoyed the seafood, pasta, and meats equally!! Highly recommend.

Oa7jom8EWhk223SdHrt-7w.text: On our last leg of our European trip we stumbled almond this Italian Tapas like restaurant. The staff was so inviting and spot on with the table service. Even our younger nephew was having a great time . The food comes out plate by plate in the order that it is prepared. Table of six and we all loved our meals.Definitely a revisit to this restaurant. I'm Piaci.

gtAX9qmLdu2a7y-mj1q-aw.text: We saw this lively bustling restaurant on a walk towards the Piccadilly underground on a Saturday night around 8:30pm/20:30. The two of us were asked if we wanted to sit by the bar and we went for it. We were seated without a wait and the bar seating was very comfortable with a purse hook under the bar and cushy seats. The service started out great, we were greeted right away and when I asked about wines he simply let me try a sample before ordering a glass. I tried one and asked for a wine with more body, and the second one was perfect.We then ordered beef tartare, a tube pasta with a sausage ragu, lobster risotto, and a special - rib eye, sweet potato and rocket. The beef tartare was pretty but came with a single layer of thin cut meat, about three slices, shaved celery, a lot of Parmesan and some rocket.Way too much cheese and not enough beef. But the quality was fine and I was happy with the celery and rocket.The tube pasta was cooked al dente and the meat sauce was very tasty- a well done dish though u get like 5 thick tubes of pasta.I was really looking forward to the risotto, but it was very disappointing. The rice was undercooked and the lobster was overcooked. The shaved truffle was a nice touch and the flavor of the dish was quite nice. But it's a little sad when my favorite component of a lobster risotto was the pan roasted grape tomatoes. The service to this point was speedy and efficient. But then there was a 15-20 minute lull. No one checked on us and our final dish was MIA. When the bartender came to clear our dishes, I asked about our last dish but he was already clearing our personal plates. I have a feeling they forgot all about our final order. He gave us new plates for our final dish which took another 7-10 minutes to come out. The ribeye was a thin cut and more medium well than medium rare. The sweet potato chips were neither crisp nor chip like - they tasted like rubbery chips when a fried item is soggified by meat juices. Finally the rocket it was served with was fine. The meat also lacked seasoning as in I don't think salt was even added. So the food was ...ok, my favorite was probably the pasta because it was cooked correctly. Finally after that they added a service charge of over 12%, I don't know if this was due to the trendy neighborhood, but be aware that they will tack on a service charge even when the service fell flat and there were just two of us. While the atmosphere was nice, I wouldn't recommend this restaurant because I think you can do better food and service wise for the prices they charge.

4Sbq-5f1VVFwXp0TuWbQ1Q.text: Central London location and clearly a very popular restaurant. We enjoyed our dinner for 4 people and were impressed with almost everything. Our 'board' of selected meats was excellent with the sausage being a standout (even over the lamb chops!). The second board we selected was seafood and was expertly grilled and had a nice selection that included scallops and langostino, a rare treat. The small side of pasta with bolognese sauce was outstanding. On the downside, the pizza was a sad rendition and the cocktails were *really* light given the cost. This is also a lively, loud restaurant so for diners looking for a quiet or romantic dinner, I would suggest trying somewhere else. Reservations are a must.

AbpQHHCJTKaVUSwimSrCzw.text: During a trip to London 2 years ago, I ate at Cicchetti twice in 2 weeks; I spent 2 weeks in London this month and ate there 4 times in a 2 week period!  This is hands down my favorite restaurant in London.  I've eaten so many things from the menu and all have been absolutely delicious!  This trip, I ate at the new Fumo spot in Covent Garden (on St Martins Lane); I was thrilled to find that it was 2 doors down from my hotel!  The staff is friendly and the decor is lovely.  I am shocked at how low the prices are given the quality of the food.  Oh how I wish a Cicchetti would open in Chicago.

photos.caption: Photo of San Carlo Cicchetti - London, United Kingdom. Lasagna al Forno
Photo of San Carlo Cicchetti - London, United Kingdom. Margherita pizza

dq3TPdxPQCzyo0Ech2b1Dw.text: This is probably the best Italian food I have ever eaten outside of Italy. I was SO happy to discover it. A big selection of dishes from all over Italy, served in small portions so that you can order several, and made with excellent, fresh ingredients. The crochette di baccalà and the burrata with prosciutto di Parma and slices of truffle on top almost made me cry.

Or2p8S0tQmcO0gb3K_gr8g.text: I was recommended to come here by the concierge at Le Meridien for a nice dinner before watching Shrek the musical.Food was okay - some were good, some were just okay. For the price of the overall meal, I think the food should have been better. If you come here, save food for the Tiramisu dessert. It's actually pretty good - I'm a tiramisu connoisseur, so for it to be good, you should definitely give it a shot.The service was VERY slow... So brace yourself to wait to get your check, paid, and served.I would certainly try other places next time so I highly doubt I will be back. If I do, it will just be for the tiramisu dessert and some drinks.

1B43pdKpiGYY9cgNdBrwrA.text: The place is Italian food, tapas style. Having read on their business card that it was rated one of the top 10 best places to have Italian food in UK, I had high expectations. We had 6 dishes to try and get a true variety but nothing stood out. Overall it was ok but nothing special.

OE5EXiFRN5FLkTD30FXsaQ.text: I was meeting up with a friend in Piccadilly Circus and we were going to go out for dinner, he was not a London local and expected me to choose an amazing restaurant. So I went on Yelp and found this little place. I came here with high expectations after reading the reviews and am so glad I was not disappointed. It is Italian small plates but that was the best thing as we could order a few plates and share it amongst us. The food and service was absolutely spot on. I would come back here as I truly had an enjoyable evening with good food and great service and the company was excellent.

V3hvhpJezhBLdeiroy4Gww.text: Wonderful dining experience. The service and food were fantastic. Came with 2 coworkers and shared several small plates. The tables are crowded together( thus only 4 stars) so we ordered our food in waves so as not to overwhelm the space. The Queen Anne scallops and tuna tartare were the table favorites. We ordered a mixture of pizza, pasta, meat, fish and desserts. The one positive about the tables being so close, we were able to chat with the local couple sitting next to us. The risotto was amazing, and although I didn't try the grappa, my colleagues said it was some of the best. I'll be back

EAdZOX5NGU7tVJvNbVO8KQ.text: Was very excited by the sexy-food-glamour of this place based on menu and food in front window presentation. Unfortunately, everything about this place outglams the good, but somewhat ordinary small-dish Italian fare. Green beans were the best dish, carpaccio fine, ravioli forgettable. Waiters, though, were adorably flirtatious, if you're willing to pay for that sort of thing.

photos.caption: Photo of San Carlo Cicchetti - London, United Kingdom. Carpaccio.

R-S-rmxBacqZqxwSGEnqVA.text: After a full "last day in London tourist travel" we literally stumbled on this. Place on the way to another.  Badly in need of some refreshment we sat at the long beautiful bar. Generous drinks.  Home made crunchy breads sticks &  a small olive plate to start.  We weren't here for dinner, just to recover from the heat &  crowds @ fortnum & mason. We ordered one of the flatbreads and it was just enough to take the edge off.  Sadly this is our last day in London &  we wished we had discovered this sooner. A nice oasis near the heart of the Circus in Picadilly.

photos.caption: Photo of San Carlo Cicchetti - London, United Kingdom. The lovely and lively interior.

4JLPBYlRJs6Y_s6FIE5eHQ.text: Great place for small plates. Veal was perfectly prepared and seafood dishes were fresh and light.  A bit noisy during the post-theater dinner hours but a good experience overall. Service was just okay.

rfTJP7uPK3NRqjp2hCx51Q.text: Someone in heaven was looking down on us when we stumbled upon this place. We came up from the Metro and were looking around. It was cold, I was hungry. I saw this place and pulled my boyfriend inside. We were greeted and asked to sit at the bar. The service is outstanding. Not to stuffy but still classy. The food is amazing! Worth the price we paid. Everything we ordered was good. The soup I had I'm still dreaming about. I think the menu changes often but we had salmon, soup of the day, cheese, green beans, ok just realizing I can't list it all out because we ended up going back there for dinner! We even considered stopping in for our last breakfast in London but though we need to try other places!London was good but this place makes me want to visit again.

fB0ggrbhUo8RlGfBLnvrGA.text: Best authentic Italian food . Small plates but delicious. The carbonara is my favorite. The spaghetti marinara is also satisfying for being a simple dish. If your really hungry you should order 2-3 meats and 4 dishes of pasta.

mzCUWsGEmErSvpaT0ZkTEA.text: I liked it. Yes it's touristy, but the service is very attentive and very frieindly. They wouldn't kick my friend and I out even though it was 12.30 at night and they already put the chairs up - they waited politely until we asked for the bill.I sticked to my vodka martini as it really one of the lowest in calories drink you can have (after red wine and vodka soda!) which was decent and strong!  And my friend enjoyed her rose champagne. The cheese board was ok, nothing spectacular. The tiramisu was amazing though. Yes we had 3 desserts among 2 of us. I was actually toying between 3 and 4 stars, but given that the restaurant has a very fine interior and I love their bar seating I don't think that a poor cheeseboard should cost them  one star.

FEl08smdo8pu7B2j60bddw.text: Lovely food but service was not as good as expected. I don't think the service worth the price, overpriced food, slow service, bad attitude. I was so excited to visit the restaurant and so excited about the food, wanted to have an amazing time with my gf there. I asked for some bread at first because the food was so slow, and the waiter told he will bring some, we asked many times but the bread never came. No recommendations, no greetings, no one brought us a menu, nothing. We were so disappointed, the only good thing is that they agreed to void the service charge.

mI6nwczFdSb70RJELysHNg.text: First time to London and our first meal we chose this restaurant that was across the street from our hotel Le Meridien. We arrived starving being up all night on the red eye from Toronto, The restaurant was nearly empty at 10:30am. The service was excellent with Italian servers busy getting ready for lunch. We chose the classic English breakfast and the eggs and smoked salmon dish. The food was very good but the real draw was the beautiful decor. Later we found out that this was a chain of restaurants and quite popular since every time we walked by they were always busy in the afternoon. They have fresh seafood on ice displayed at the front window of the restaurant. We wanted to come back for lunch or dinner but we felt that we had to try other restaurants. When in London San Carlo Cicchetti is an excellent choice.

photos.caption: Photo of San Carlo Cicchetti - London, United Kingdom
Photo of San Carlo Cicchetti - London, United Kingdom
Photo of San Carlo Cicchetti - London, United Kingdom

gxQWtsuRt_OjqJ2u_lgDww.text: We stopped in for lunch and were very surprised by the quality of food and service we received. This location is in the heart of Piccadilly, so you dont expect the quality to be as high. Its a tapa's style restaurant so my wife and i shared 4 dishes, we had a glass of wine each and each had a dessert. The price for all was less 68 pounds. Great deal, great food. It is busy and noisy but well worth the visit.

AjmY0KhZshoBvt0jXczOqQ.text: The food quality here is high but the service is so bad that I had to give the a 3*. The problem with this restaurant is that they just don't care if you come or not. I have called to make reservations before and they don't pick up or reply to emails. Then when I walk in they have spots available. If the tables are empty they will seat you at the bar. If you don't dress well they look down on you. Tough place.

2IswbogtlJ71MttWMEGiGw.text: If you want to feel like you're eating at railway station this is the place for you. The place is so busy and loud you cannot hear the waiter standing next to you. We ordered the spaghetti with clams in white wine sauce which turned out to have no sauce. It's hit and miss as the ravioli and burrata were good dishes.

htB-49kJqkqn3orJTrO1rw.text: This is a great Italian restaurant with super friendly staff. The menu has plenty of options. The food is tapas so plan on sharing with your friends and family. We had a few pizzas, spaghetti, sausage and calamari. All of it was great!Highly recommend this place if your in central London....

HplBcHT7XLH79gbzGgGM3A.text: Lovely Italian restaurant in the heart of Piccadilly Square.  This restaurant was recommended by a friend and I just have to write up on it.  The staff was extremely friendly and inviting, the dishes very tasty and fresh.   Love the vibe in this place.  The jetlag didn't allow us to stay long since my 20 month old was starting to act up but even so the waiters tried to entertain him and made our dining experience even more enjoyable.  We ordered the margarita pizza, truffle ravioli, croquets and lobster pasta.  All cooked to perfection and steaming hot.  Highly recommend this place and will be going next time we are in town.

44-c2YlbXZqS7Ljo5chH3Q.text: Excellent Italian in a heavily traffic tourist area- you will have to wait if you can get a walk in at all, make a reservation. Food is very good, has seating at the bar and an extensive wine list. Italian family owned and operated, good for business meals.

5487pJ8y2pEHB2l5ASSi3g.text: Great service and food. Right sized portions for the price like sitting at bar. Great wine selection and decadent deserts.

TtneEIhBvLULljo9ASHMaQ.text: Wow...just wow wow wow!!! This goes down as one of the best dining experiences I have ever had. Genuinely, the whole experience was a pleasure. San Carlo Cicchetti is located literally a stones throw from Piccadilly Circus. When my friend Zoe suggested having dinner there I looked up the location and wondered what I was in store for. As soon as you step through the door way you immediately feel as if you have been transported to another place, a side street perhaps off Via Condotti in Roma. With seats at the bar we relaxed and took in the atmosphere. The staff are all Italian from what i could tell and speak to each other in Italian, when at the bar it just sets the tone wonderfully. We agreed that the overall atmosphere of the place is perfect, the background music is just below the level of the chatter and if there is a lull in conversation it fills the space. Small touch but shows an attention to detail.The restaurant concept is in a sense similar to tapas, a full Italian menu but the plate sizes are small and designed so that you can try 5 or 6 different things between two. From memory we had the calamari fritti, the truffle croquettes, spaghetti bolagnese (made to Mums recipe), gnocchi with fresh crab. For the wine we shared a love red from Puglia, its drank very smoothly and was very quaff-able .To finish I had the tiramisu which was served with a glass of marsala and Zoe the pistachio sponge cake. Both were to die for for, Zoe's description of the tiramisu said everything, "Its so light its as if it were made by angels"! what else can you say to that other than this is a incredible place with great staff and its the first of many visits I will be making.San Carlo Cicchetti comes Highly JD Recommened.N.B. Side note Bill Nighy was there on the same night, we were slightly star struck :o)

photos.caption: Photo of San Carlo Cicchetti - London, United Kingdom. Truffle croquettes! Stunning
Photo of San Carlo Cicchetti - London, United Kingdom. Bill Nighy photo bomb
Photo of San Carlo Cicchetti - London, United Kingdom. Heavenly

jOXHK77ptOOuGW_hLlS0Xg.text: Good food and service.  I had the caprese and lobster linguini.  I wish the pasta was a bit warmer when it arrived but its probably negligible. Enjoyed a great red wine here.  I would return and probably dress a bit better.  I was smart casual that day but felt a little more formal. Business meetings abound.

vbz2HdhQVev9Kxw7ztZkIA.text: Beautiful restaurant, with beautiful decor especially for Christmas.  I sat at the bar and all of the staff was extremely kind and helpful.  I ordered a ravioli with truffles on top and my mouth still waters thinking about it. There were so many dishes with truffles, it was hard to decide what to order.  I would definitely come here again!

H7z9aQP9Ag2_RnzQxVTguw.text: Great ambience, all Italian staff, and unique tapas approach to Italian food.  I haven't had anything I didn't love.  It is crowded so book well ahead. Bar is often open and has fast service from the happy bar staff.

photos.caption: Photo of San Carlo Cicchetti - London, United Kingdom. Truffle and pecorino ravioli.  Creamy semi-heavy cheese with light truffle.  Decadent. Would still rank the sea bass above.  WOW
Photo of San Carlo Cicchetti - London, United Kingdom. Open wood oven in rear.

t01iZQAptpK-XUR5CLmSlg.text: Amazing food, fast and fantastic service! Would definitely recommend to friends and family.

5mEXwNjfx-fi6ya9vfpwNw.text: Very good Italian small plates in a fancy marble dining room in the midst of a bunch of tourist traps.I had never come to this place before it was recommended by a coworker because I always expected it to be just another tourist joint with mediocre food for too much money.  I was fortunately very mistaken.First off, the menu on the web site is not at all reflective of what they actually have in the restaurant.  There are 2x-3x more small plates available than what appears on the site, including a bunch of interesting specials.  The space is fancy bordering on gaudy, but it's all very clean and organized, so it works.  We ordered about 10 items for 3 of us for a business lunch, and while the waiter was difficult to understand, the service was good and the food came out rapidly.  The highlights for me were an octopus special, the sea bream with artichoke, and the antipasti, all of which were delicious.  No complaints about any of the others, either - their kitchen cranks out a lot of high quality plates very quickly.My only problem was with the affogato that I got for dessert.  Good affogato should be served with the gelato and the espresso separate, so that the espresso can be poured over it a little at a time and you can get the wonderful combination of hot and cold, sweet and bitter, before the whole thing rapidly turns into soup.  Ours was served all together, and it was already mostly in the latter state.  Overall, I'm settling on 4 stars, choosing to round down because despite the very good small plates, it's not really my kind of atmosphere, and I'd probably only go there with people from work.

5knYVAHLryA8g9QbPDdrWg.text: We have been in London for 5 days, following our 5 days in Bath. Our favorite restaurant in England is this Italian gem. Many other restaurants have good food and efficient service, but none of them have FANTASTIC food AND service!  We first went for breakfast. Then we went for lunch. When we returned, the staff remembered us and treated us like VIP's. The menu has so many wonderful dishes to choose from. Everything is rich, fresh, homemade and delicious. Food is served Tapas style. You're encouraged to order a few plates and share. For lunch we had fresh pasta with Bolognese sauce, veal and morel mushrooms, gnocchi with Gorgonzola sauce served in a parmigiana cheese bowl. Plus, beans in olive oil and lemon, and zucchini sticks. Every dish was elegant and wonderful!  We both wanted to try more dishes, but we were full. Of course we had to have dessert. As recommended, I had the pastiche tart. I would not have ordered this, but I was talked into it. It was out of this world!The coffees are great. The wine list is extensive. The mixed drink offerings look inventive and thoughtful. We are hoping to return tomorrow if time allows!The restaurant has a clean, elegant style. It's easy to get to, as the underground has the Piccadilly stop right on the corner.  We enjoy good service, and the staff at San Carlo Cicchetti is second to none!       We went again today for a late lunch. I just have to update yesterday's review. The place was hopping at 2:40pm. We were recognized and given a table at our favorite servers station. Fabrizio is a world class professional!  He welcomed us warmly and helped us plan our meal. Everything he recommended was spot-on. We indulged in 5 courses, drinks, and dessert. I had 2 versions of champagne cocktails..fabulous!  My husband had chianti. As we enjoyed each bite, we watched the workings of this busy fast-paced restaurant. There are many servers and supervisors. Nobody here has a moments down time. Constantly scanning the tables for empty glasses, plates that need replacing, and anything else diners might need. I'm telling you, it's like a highly orchestrated dance..fascinating. We just enjoyed every minute and every bite. We will miss Fabrizio and the flawless, warm, and much appreciated service he provided.

photos.caption: Photo of San Carlo Cicchetti - London, United Kingdom

t8Ihy0RJcdVBVxV3M7Eb-g.text: I went to London on vacation with my family. We were walking around Picadilly circle and we decide to go in this amazing place. We got the best food and service we've ever gotten in our lives.We got the eggplant, pizzeta, lobster, prosciutto, and ravioli. The desert was amazing too! The wine, the food, service, the place.. Everything was perfect! Definitely the best place in London!

photos.caption: Photo of San Carlo Cicchetti - London, United Kingdom
Photo of San Carlo Cicchetti - London, United Kingdom. Tiramisu
Photo of San Carlo Cicchetti - London, United Kingdom

tJ4MJfbmEj0sgj0zRpLtXw.text: Amazing, amazing, amazing!!!!   World class Italian served on small plates,  You and your date can share 5 or 6 incredible dishes.  Awesome!!!

photos.caption: Photo of San Carlo Cicchetti - London, United Kingdom

pyAQ-LOGTZ_qK2DlL9M3wQ.text: This restaurant is amazing! My boyfriend and I were on travel in London when we passed this gem. They specialize in small plates so you can try many different Italian dishes. The ambiance is great as well! If you want to have an authentic Italian meal, come here. The servers are yelling at each other in Italian, and slamming the cappuccino cups! It doesn't interfere with having a wonderful meal filled with conversation!

-DXd_MV7dFddopmrMgiZgA.text: While wandering the area with empty stomachs, my husband and I found this place and went in, hoping not to need a reservation for lunch (it looked a little like a place that might require such a thing). We didn't, and were quickly seated at a side/bench table. The waiter explained the shareable small plate menu, and we ordered a bunch of recommended items. There was a fish and citrus plate, a veal and pasta plate, a cheese ravioli plate and another... and they were all very, VERY good.The wine was good, the service was amazing, the food was just so ridiculously perfect and we left feeling very satisfied. Unfortunately, I don't live in London anymore, but if I did... I would be back here on the reg!

photos.caption: Photo of San Carlo Cicchetti - London, United Kingdom
Photo of San Carlo Cicchetti - London, United Kingdom

AqbyUc9xrDR6z-UfIXqcMA.text: Stopped for lunch and had a great meal. Great food and staff was excellent. Felt like I was in Italy

kunEJ5eLKSXtEnJjmthnMg.text: Raphaella is the best!  He was able to recommend amazing food and wine.  Food was beautifully presented, and exquisite!  Truffle is delicious!!

Z-5eANc_sqGJQQswa4133g.text: Señor Francesco is the best manager and took care of us very well. He recommended great drinks and an awesome terra plate. I would dare to say, "lo amo"! Great pricing and excellent staff. Come here to have a taste of Italy in London.

m3QMHn8eGOL_FyvupKUnEA.text: Beautiful and ornate Italian inspired decor, together with very friendly staff.  Everybody seems to have an Italian accent, you almost feel like you're in Italy and being served authentic Italian food. Really cute that they have a tomato on each table instead of flowers.  I guess the tomato does represents Italian food, forming the basic red sauce for most of its signature dishes. We were a party of 10 and basically ordered two of everything to share.   One of the desserts we ordered, was quite a show.  Can"t remember the exact name but it had sambuca and the waiter set it alight before we ate it.  A little on the pricey side but worth visiting. All the food was Belisimo! and I would definitely go back again.

photos.caption: Photo of San Carlo Cicchetti - London, United Kingdom. Hazelnut and chocolate dessert
Photo of San Carlo Cicchetti - London, United Kingdom. Tiramisu
Photo of San Carlo Cicchetti - London, United Kingdom. A tomato on every table instead of flowers

8PQoUZQ5ZackAcIhkHHK9g.text: Authentic Italian food! Tapas-style! Great way to try a little bit of everything!  Essentially you had to roll us out of there!Centrally located in the middle of Piccadilly - easy to get to by train, walk or cab.  Beautifully decorated venue.  If you don't have a reservation, be prepared to either wait OR sit at the bar - or both.  But it's fine, worth it - and have to say, reasonably priced!Staff is super welcoming, adorably friendly, handsome, Italian men - what's not to like?! AND the food is delicious! It's fresh, comes out relatively quick and is amazing.  My favorites? Olives tapenade,Lobster ravioli, and spaghetti bolgonese.  Although, everything we had was pretty fabulous. We will definitely be back! Sitting at bar wasn't the best, so hoping to get a table next time!

9WXwrHG-fokfigDvMVq_lg.text: After an overnight flight from the states and a quick four mile run, I needed some fuel.  The concierge at Le Meridian recommended this place.  I am very happy he did.  It's tapas style Italian.  It was only me, so I only got two dishes.  The octopus with paprika potatoes and the osso bucco over risotto.  The octopus was very good.  Tender, meaty, nice flavors.  The osso bucco was amazing.  I love osso bucco and this osso bucco was divine. Plenty of marrow and the sauce was rich and tangy.  Lick the plate good (even though I did not).Friendly and accommodating  service.  If it's packed, do not be afraid to sit at the bar.

URuuWnyjLlVeTgmQ5pZ_Gw.text: We had a reservation, which is advised. The staff are very nice and helpful. The size type Tapas food are very good for sharers. Some are better than others. The deserts are quite good as well. The final bill for the food eaten was expected.

e9XS32qQdksepC4xSZCyqA.text: Every bit as good as the reviews here seem to indicate.   Outstanding in every sense from the décor, to the service, and most importantly to the food.  Serves primarily smaller size dishes intended to be shared so you can order a larger variety of options to try.  Cacio e Pepe was my personal favorite and should not be missed.One piece of advice - plan ahead and get a reservation in advance.   I walked in as a party of 3 on a Wed evening looking for a table.  Luckily, we came early (5pm) and managed to get a seat.  Next available reservation was not til 10pm.   This place is not exactly a well kept secret.

RINcdlRgIoZV4Ru4j4q2cg.text: I think this place is really ok even though I hear a lot of good recommendations. They have tapas style Italian food. I like the idea as I can try more food. Two plates are about the right amount for one person. The risotto lobster is ok. Nothing special. The rice is a bit raw. The lasagna has tons of cheese but it tastes pretty good. The special pasta with mussels, clams, and langoustines is interesting when this dish comes on the table, it's wrapped in a plastic bag and then they unwrap it and put on the plate. Again, the taste is ordinary and the pasta is a bit undercooked and hard. The desert that comes with 4 small desert bites for 2 and a small glass of wine is great. I like the wine and the raspberry desert the most. The service here in general is ok. Sometimes I feel that some of them have pissy face/attitude.

photos.caption: Photo of San Carlo Cicchetti - London, United Kingdom

eju3Aj9CWc3-D0Hhw_Ji8g.text: Beautifully balanced dishes, excellent vegetarian options, fragrant truffle elements... and they serve the best pistachio ice cream I have ever had in my life.Immaculate service. We needed to catch a show, and they were prompt.

ZaU98QhiLdEjHfO6lMY58g.text: We visited for appetizers in a mega-rush and were met with the greatest aplomb and professionalism. My paccheri was incredibly tasty as was the tartare and burrata.  We were in and out in 30 min with a service finesse that met the 5 star level.

XSkX-mksbZnkpbG-5R8m3A.text: I really loved this place. An Italian business through and through. If you've been to Venice, this will bring you back instantly. The food was wonderful, the wine fun and adventurous, and the service was exceptional. When told that my wife was gluten-free, they came over to talk, and assured her they would keep her safe. Wonderful job. We sat at the bar, which was fun, but the main room looks just as inviting. Small plates of arancini, steak, salads, meatballs, seafood, etc. All were wonderful.

fwwyhp-P074RiV-BjxzgDg.text: Absolutely enjoyed my lunch experience here. Interestingly, the place is Italian food but in tapas style. Nonetheless, my friend and I each ordered a starter and a main, and dining in the standard manner still worked as the portions were not too bad. I had crab with avocado for starter then spaghetti vongole for main. Both dishes were very good. I had tiramisu for dessert as well, and it was possibly the best I had ever had. All in all, very fresh and solid food. Service was also very good. Despite the busy-ness, our waiter was prompt and got the job done well.Ambience was quite spacious and fashionable. Didn't realise it would be so, given it's located in the heart of the hustle and bustle, but they managed to pull off making one believe she was in a proper Italian restaurant in a posh neighbourhood.Would definitely go back in a heartbeat!

2b_JuhYQmmrcyA0PjqQsGA.text: Really good and interesting Italian restaurant.  Good Italian wine list that is reasonable.  Had a number of small plates and dessert and was super satisfied.  I didn't eat one thing that wasn't fantastic.  Very good and helpful service.

hkH2_CIVOEzg33LlLKxmAQ.text: The best Italian food I've ever had. Everything is Italian - ambiance, staff, food. It looks like an upscale restaurant but you can find a quiet romantic table for two or a corner for a family dinner. The servings are appetizer-size portions - ideal for 2-3 people to share but that way give you chance to try 5-6 per table. The food is really fresh and made to perfection. The wasn't anything greasy or over/under-cooked. I can't compliment more how good it was. We were lucky to walk-in on cancelled table, otherwise advance reservations are highly recommended.

y9izbnKCKpdgkKLaGGqmLg.text: Really good Italian food... pasta was al dente.. firm but cooked.  Portions isn't so large and so I managed to add a mixed salad and a grilled ribeye to my lunch...

photos.caption: Photo of San Carlo Cicchetti - London, United Kingdom
Photo of San Carlo Cicchetti - London, United Kingdom. Spaghettini and the ribeye special...

t1qA8XScLYbOno8pIoIPEQ.text: Best meal we ate in London. Fun atmosphere, enthusiastic servers and UH-mazing food. We had to leave early to catch a show, but we ended up walking back after to get dessert. Definitely go here!

OePI-RhWaF_Dpzfkf3CoJQ.text: The place is fantastic and the food really amazing. portions are medium (larger than a tapas) smaller than a typical size. The quality is amazing. There is really no better quality for Italian food in london. The staff is great and service is fast. You would need 2/3 Cicchetti for a normal dinner with an average of 8£Well done

photos.caption: Photo of San Carlo Cicchetti - London, United Kingdom
Photo of San Carlo Cicchetti - London, United Kingdom
Photo of San Carlo Cicchetti - London, United Kingdom

OHVxypmXTJM9sxB5mZZAgA.text: This is truly one of my favorite restaurants in the world. You really can't go wrong here. The wine is amazing, the restaurant is beautiful and the food is absolutely incredible!!The tapas style dishes allow you to order a bunch of different things to try and with food this good, you'll want to try as much as possible. The meatballs and lasagna are two of my favorites along with the pizza! Enjoy!! :)

photos.caption: Photo of San Carlo Cicchetti - London, United Kingdom. Love this freaking food!!!

kC18n0ScUqFGMLCE0RKCQg.text: I sat at the bar and enjoyed the tuna tartar, Tuscan stew, pistachio pie and some great wine.

n-_qqZSv3Fv0nmOqV0SpNQ.text: Great food, great atmosphere. Get away from the Fish and Chips and try this place out. Tmenu is Tapas, so we ordered everything we wanted and were able to share. Huge Pizza, Pasta and high end meats on the menu. Service was great and friendly, we will certainly be back next time in London.

hUzJWD91G5CXDNwreGjFlA.text: We searched for restaurants open and this one showed it closed at 11:30pm.  We arrived a little before 11pm and the restaurant shooed us out as we were coming in the front door.  They said they were closed yet had several people still eating.  We would have ordered something simple and fast if they had even taken the time to talk to us.

hx_YF1Y6DHxQwnkA1I3LiQ.text: Decent Italian tapas restaurant and bar in the heart of Piccadilly Sq., with another restaurant in Covent Garden. I had a grilled avocado for £6 that turned out to only be 1/4 th of an avocado, not the freshest or most flavorful at that. Left me feeling cheated from the get-go.Next, I tried the paparadelle parmigiana cheese and portobello mushrooms w truffle-- Okay, no truffle in it whatsoever, prob just truffle oil which we know is anything but. Then there was the mushrooms, kinda slimy and not the most flavorful. Almost no cheese grated into it. The big ribbons of paparadelle were nicely cooked however, just a minute or so beyond al dente, which always works for me. Not bad but not particularly noteworthy. Decent.The service here is extremely attentive as they hustle folks in and out but it is very good... most of the waiters are (Italian) foreigners so ordering was a little difficult but fine ultimately. I liked my affordable glass of nice and youngish montolpulciano red wine the most. That and the pretty interior. At £26+ I might look elsewhere...*** / ***** from me.

photos.caption: Photo of San Carlo Cicchetti - London, United Kingdom
Photo of San Carlo Cicchetti - London, United Kingdom
Photo of San Carlo Cicchetti - London, United Kingdom

rT_ZBosqdStgzciwSKJEYQ.text: Stumbled upon this classy looking place right in the center of Piccadilly bustle. After reading other reviews after eating here, in not sure if I felt the same how about the food. I love Italian food and I went in expecting full dishes, keep in mind these are tapas style. Quantity is little and to share! If you don't watch out it adds up pretty fast too! We got the cacio e pepe which was so good. Perfectly peppery, perfectly creamy. Also ordered the spinach and ricotta ravioli which was 2 jumbo raviolis with fresh tomato sauce, why I thought was just ok. The margherita pizza reminded me of appetizer flatbread and comparable to something I'd get in the states. The service was a bit over the place, we had like 4 waiters come through but all friendly.

photos.caption: Photo of San Carlo Cicchetti - London, United Kingdom. Margherita Pizza

4QHa_5wZt4ZsohS8Aw3aAQ.text: Nice Italian fair! Our family of four has enjoyed the food. Baked sea bass and pizza margarita were excellent; halibut and spaghetti with clams in white wine sauce were Ok.

7JpJOFNNv1I3vSQdauOuJA.text: Great italian food in an unlikely setting. My favorite restaurant in London. Top 10 anywhere.

photos.caption: Photo of San Carlo Cicchetti - London, United Kingdom
Photo of San Carlo Cicchetti - London, United Kingdom
Photo of San Carlo Cicchetti - London, United Kingdom

2c2IUSwLL-SKYpOsXCfLeg.text: One of the best restaurants that I've been to in London. If you're looking for Italian food this place is it. The linguine and clams in white wine sauce was delicious. (I took a picture halfway through my meal because it was so delicious.) Be sure to make a reservation because this place gets packed. Will definitely be back again

photos.caption: Photo of San Carlo Cicchetti - London, United Kingdom

xT3WujZVVslhyhEGP-I9cQ.text: Turned down for service because they are "closed" ... restaurant 1/2 full of people. Website says they close in an half an hour. I simply wanted a cappuccino. Manager said they can't serve people after 11. I don't buy it.

PlRGeaTx7SpIVxWHMrVwYA.text: You will NOT be disappointed. Every dish was served hot, fresh and screamed authentic modern Italian. Plan on sharing multiple dishes and experiment with the menu. You won't regret it. Probably our favorite was the gnocchi gorgonzola. Unreal!

KE4IC3o3-rrn7MT9a00Rtw.text: This place is amazing. The food is outstanding and the servers are super nice. The food came in litle portions so even better because we could order server all dishes and share them togheter. I would like to come back and try more from the menu.

7g10r_Jhyan_KtSVBI2UWw.text: In the heart of Piccadilly Circus in the middle of  the hustle and bustle you will only imagine to find tourist trap restaurants...not the case here...  This Italian Restaurant has is the ultimate gourmet experience.  Believe it or not this establishment is packed mostly with local people with high expectations.The ambiance is of course Italian filled with love and passion.Walked in without a reservation. That of course was not a problem.  Italians welcome everyone! The menu has an array of options, family style. But here is the tip... Allow your server to take the lead,  Oh God, they know how to touch your heart and senses... (Only an Italian can deliver this effect)The Truffle Ravioli was beyond my expectations.  This is the perfect place to be blind folded and allow an Italian to take the lead... risky right?! Allow them.The wine list superb... The wine selected for what I would call A Caesar's feast was a Barolo Figli.The service here is a bright 5 Stars! Everyone is genuinely delightful.

photos.caption: Photo of San Carlo Cicchetti - London, United Kingdom
Photo of San Carlo Cicchetti - London, United Kingdom
Photo of San Carlo Cicchetti - London, United Kingdom

Yk6XvDG-8U-3XWtJ4n9lEg.text: Location is by all means excellent. I had Burrata and Vongole.  The appetizer was good as expected but Vongole was a way too salty.  It was like eating salt and spaghetti.   The service was not very good.  I had a counter seat but was not attended for a long time.

CTQRNnWpOMoeq5Kkm0Bt5A.text: Great ambiance, the food is good, and they have seating at the bar for dinner. Not many restaurants in the area do that. The Bartenders offered lovely recommendations and wine pairings.

photos.caption: Photo of San Carlo Cicchetti - London, United Kingdom

g0f17KM4SZ6eevKDh7oidA.text: Exceptional evening. We got into London later than expected on a Sunday evening and wanted a really good Italian meal. San Carlo did NOT disappoint. Fabulous service from the minute we walked in through after dinner drinks. The reviews were good, but definitely didnt do it justice. The minute we sat down we were explained how the menu works and to share all of our options. Between us we had a salad, a specialty pasta, a regular pasta (pasta is all homemade and SO fresh) and a pizza. We probably could have fit in one more entree between us, however dessert was too tempting. We also had a bottle of the Cabernet (exceptional) and very fair prices considering its all imported Italian wine. We finished with the tiramisu (homemade I am certain) and two glasses of port. If you are a port fan, spring for the good stuff. The service was impeccable the entire time and the pizzas are stone fired in the back, so I highly recommend if you are wondering what to get. Considering this is in the middle of a very touristy area its a pleasant surprise and somewhere I will not only recommend but return to.

pBTwzosnTTr-3Pmc6TVTEA.text: Great local spot for Italian food. Unfortunately for us, we were tourists so yes, we did get a few odd looks from the wait staff, (minus one star for making me feel awkward), but the food here more than makes up for the service!!! My friend had the arancini, the stuffed and friend rice balls, which she loved. But I think the star of the evening was the proscuitto plate (which comes with truffle and burrata cheese). These 3 ingredients on the same plate were a match made in gastronomy heaven!!! After one bite, I wanted to hide in a corner and eat in all myself....no sharing here!!! Hehe. We also ordered the carpaccio, which was equally delicious and topped with a shaving of parmesan cheese (another great pairing by the chef).  This place is great! Just with the appetizers alone, you can have a fantastic meal.

photos.caption: Photo of San Carlo Cicchetti - London, United Kingdom. The window display is gorgeous!
Photo of San Carlo Cicchetti - London, United Kingdom. Proscuitto with truffle and burrata
Photo of San Carlo Cicchetti - London, United Kingdom. Beautiful exterior!

thGWdIoe0cHbQ_Eqq0sBCg.text: Incredible!!This is Italian food. Italian drinks. Italian hospitality. Italian style.On arrival the venue was very brightly lit and as it was sunny out it gave a real glitzy look. Later, the lights come down for a warmer atmosphere. Perfectly timed.We were seated & served promptly and attentively. Our waiter suggested antipasti & wine. Very knowledgeable & helpful.Our food arrived and it was like being transported to the motherland. Every flavour was on point, fresh and delicious.If you haven't been, treat yourself.

photos.caption: Photo of San Carlo Cicchetti - London, United Kingdom
Photo of San Carlo Cicchetti - London, United Kingdom. Cannolo
Photo of San Carlo Cicchetti - London, United Kingdom. Prosecco

nfNWInSkrc4t6ywJE32aJA.text: Popped in to the bar on a Thursday night and the drinks were good, pretty sweet, but then we had the fried mozzarella (very bland) and asparagus (salty and uncomplex) and I didn't feel the food was very good at all.

33zx4mLLujrU8IaOInUpKA.text: Good italian place but the portion is small. We ordered calamari, tomato salad, pastas, pizza, some appetizers,scallops and veal. Please don't order their pastas and pizza. Pizza dough is awful, pasta has no flavor. I don't know what's wrong with this. It's an Italian restaurant!!! But they do other dishes just fine...hmmmm

dwx8MTaNC-8Eew0u5NHLEw.text: The place is AMAZING!  The food is served "Tapa" style (small plates). So they are meant to share. It is VERY authentic Italian. All the waiters and workers speak Italian too. You feel like you're in Italy. I wished we were more hungry when we went the first night, so we went back a second night just for dessert. The tiramisu and cannolis were amazing. The cannolis were served on a bed of Nutella. Is that a plus, or what?!? Just can't say enough. If you want Italian bear Picadilly, try it out. I think you'll love it!

zi_xaSfQmryzVLu8BJziTA.text: Great place to drop in for Italian tapas. I ate here earlier this year and though it was good. I came back from a 2 week trip to Italy and realized this place is pretty legit. Food is great. Staff is pushy. The portion sizes are pretty small, so you really do need 5-6 dishes for 2 people. Beware of how much you order as it'll get pricey before you know it. My favorite dishes on the menu are the tagliatelle bolognas, seafood spaghetti, and steak. If you're able to order off the seasonal menu, definitely give the octopus a lobster risotto a try! The restaurant staff seem to be from Italy and give you nice warm welcomes in Italian. They sometimes come off as a bit pushy. My friend and I ordered way too much food and was not interested in dessert or coffee/tea and the server kept pressuring us to order more. You'll want to make a reservation because they get pretty packed. I came at 5:45pm, before the dinner crowd, and got seated right away, but the server definitely made it clear he was doing us a favor.

photos.caption: Photo of San Carlo Cicchetti - London, United Kingdom. Steak
Photo of San Carlo Cicchetti - London, United Kingdom. Pizza fritta
Photo of San Carlo Cicchetti - London, United Kingdom. Octopus
